An **orcish helm** is a type of [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as an **iron skull cap** when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [5.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Any [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") player character that would start the game with a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") will start with an orcish helm instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution would occur.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

In addition to random generation, non-[undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") have a 1⁄2 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an orcish helm among their armor.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, an orcish helm grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

Orcish helms are usually the first type of helm encountered, since orcish monsters such as [goblins](/wiki/Goblin "Goblin") are commonplace in the early game. They can provide a small source of early AC for a starting character, along with protection from [falling rock traps](/wiki/Falling_rock_trap "Falling rock trap") - fortunate [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero") may happen across early orcish helms at +3 or higher enchantment. Orcish helms are eventually replaced towards the end of the early game; in later stages, they make decent fodder for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling").

## History

The orcish helm first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

In variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials"), unidentified orcish helms may appear as simply **skull caps**. Some variants may give orcs (including the player) an AC bonus for wearing an orcish helm.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), orcish [Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") that start the game with a helmet will instead have an orcish helm, using the existing vanilla code for player race-role substitutions.

[Gnolls](/wiki/Gnoll "Gnoll") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an orcish helm, while gnoll warriors have a 1⁄2 chance, and gnoll cheftians will always generate with one. [Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a [dented pot](/wiki/Dented_pot "Dented pot") will produce an orcish helm, and upgrading an orcish helm produces a [dwarvish iron helm](/wiki/Dwarvish_iron_helm "Dwarvish iron helm").

All of the above is also applicable to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), orcish helms grant +3 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), orcish helms grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), an orcish helm grants 1 AC and 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), orcish helms have their [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") increased to 50 aum.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), orcish helms grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

Orcish [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") will start with an orcish helm in place of the role's standard [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet"). Orcish [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") will often generate with orcish helms.

An orcish helm can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a dented pot and an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger"). An orcish helm can be combined with [orcish boots](/wiki/Orcish_boots "Orcish boots") to create an [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield"), and can be combined with an orcish shield to create [orcish ring mail](/wiki/Orcish_ring_mail "Orcish ring mail").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), orcish helms grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

In addition to SLASH'EM and EvilHack details, upgrading an orcish helm will produce a dwarvish helm as in SLASH'EM, but only "upgrading" a dwarvish helm will produce an orcish helm.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 218](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L218): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 397](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L397): *default orcish armor*
